homes are to be affixed including the installation of utilities the construction of streets and either final site grading or the pouring of concrete pads flood or flooding means a general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of normally dry land areas from 1 the overflow of inland  andor 2 the unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source flood boundary and floodway map fbfm means an official map of a community on which the administrator has delineated both special flood hazard areas and the designated regulatory floodway flood elevation determination means a determination by the administrator of the water surface elevations of the base flood that is the flood level that has a one percent or greater chance of occurrence in any given year flood elevation study means an examination evaluation and determination of flood hazards flood fringe means the area outside the floodway encroachment lines but still subject to inundation by the regulatory flood flood hazard boundary map fhbm means an official map of a community issued by the administrator where the boundaries of the flood areas having special flood hazards have been designated as unnumbered or numbered a zones flood insurance rate map firm means an official map of a community on which the administrator has delineated both the special flood hazard areas and the risk premium zones applicable to the community flood insurance study fis means an examination evaluation and determination of flood hazards and if appropriate corresponding water surface elevations floodplain or floodprone area means any land area susceptible to being inundated by water from any source see flooding floodplain management means the operation of an overall program of corrective and preventive measures for reducing flood damage including but not limited to emergency preparedness plans flood control works and floodplain management regulations floodplain management regulations means zoning ordinances subdivision regulations building codes health regulations special purpose ordinances such as floodplain and grading ordinances and other applications of police power the term describes such state or local regulations in any combination thereof that provide standards for the purpose of flood damage prevention and reduction floodproofing means any combination of structural and nonstructural additions changes or adjustments to structures that reduce or eliminate flood damage to real estate or improved real property water and sanitary facilities or structures and their contents floodway or regulatory floodway means the channel of a river or other watercourse and the adjacent land areas that must be reserved in order to discharge the base flood without cumulatively increasing the water surface elevation more than one foot floodway encroachment lines means the lines marking the limits of floodways on federal state and local floodplain maps freeboard means a factor of safety usually expressed in feet above a flood level for purposes of floodplain management freeboard tends to compensate for the many unknown factors that could contribute to flood heights greater than the height calculated for a selected size flood and floodway conditions such as bridge openings and the hydrological effect of urbanization of the watershed functionally dependent use means a use that cannot perform its intended purpose unless it is located or carried out in close proximity to water this term includes only docking facilities and facilities that are necessary for the loading and unloading of cargo or passengers but does not include longterm storage or related manufacturing facilities highest adjacent grade means the highest natural elevation of action policy and program purpose this article is for the purpose of declaring and reaffirming the intent of the city to ensure that no individual otherwise qualified in the pursuit of or actual employment by the city shall be discriminated against because of race color creed religion sex handicap age marital status national origin or political opinion or affiliation these policies and procedures are adopted to ensure that the city is in compliance with the intent and purposes of title vii of the civil rights act of 196 as amended  and the administrative regulations promulgated to ensure compliance by all recipients of federal funds and providers of federal services   a 11111980 responsibility for implementation each elected and appointed official shall be responsible for ensuring that the principles and policies contained in this article and plan are implemented in their respective departments andor divisions of city government and employment   b 11111980 dissemination the equal employment opportunity policy and the major components of the affirmative action plan shall be disseminated to all city officials employees recruitment sources contractors suppliers and residents upon request   c 11111980 scope a the affirmative action plan shall cover all areas of personnel administration including but not limited to recruitment hiring placement promotion rates of pay or compensation benefits demotion training and apprenticeships discipline and working conditions layoffs recalls terminations and other conditions of employment b the city shall encourage its contractors and suppliers to develop and implement programs to ensure equal employment opportunity c all managers and supervisors will be held responsible and accountable for the implementation and administration of the policies of affirmative action   d 11111980 adoption and implementation a formal affirmative action plan has been developed and adopted by the city council as if fully set forth in this section the plan contains an analysis of the current work force delegation of authority for implementation and monitoring establish criteria for evaluation and specific steps to be taken to implement the program a copy of the plan is available in the office of the city clerk   e 11111980 secs 22242249  reserved article iii  discriminatory housing practices later and conform to the federal manufactured home and safety standards established by hud manufactured home space means that area of land within a manufactured home park set aside for use as a site for one modular or manufactured home including the open spaces around said home as required in this article manufactured or doublewide manufactured home means a structure as defined in this section and having been built in two sections approximately of equal length at a factory which two sections are transported over the road separately with assembly into one structure of a width of not less than 22 feet occurring at the destination small room or porch additions shall not be defined as double wide the home shall have a manufacture date of  or later and conform to the federal manufactured home and safety standards established by hud manufactured or modular home subdivision means an area of land containing not less than 50 lots and the public streets necessary to serve such lots the purpose of which is to convey in fee the individual lots for the location of said homes in a permanent fashion on permanent foundations mobile home means a structure as defined in this section and being of a width of less than 22 feet measured between the permanent sidewalls thereof and has a manufacturer date before  and does not comply with the federal manufactured home and safety standards established by hud modular home means a residential structure assembled in total or in several sections at a factory and transported over the road by truck to its designation a modular home as distinct from a manufactured or mobile home shall have exterior building materials and appearance similar to the customary singlefamily structure in the neighborhood a minimum 512 roof pitch a minimum eave overhang of 12 inches composition shingles and shall be permanently situated on a foundation and not equipped with the necessary service connection and not made so as to be readily movable as a unit or units on its or their own running gear and not designed to be used as a dwelling unit or units without a permanent foundation the structure shall also be constructed to minimum standards adopted by the local building codes of the city street means a rightofway which affords principal means of vehicular access to or modular home manufactured home mobile home or trailer park and which is held in fee by the public or a governmental unit thereof trailer means a vehicle equipped with wheels and normally towed over the road behind an automobile or truck trailer advertising means a trailer as defined in this section but carrying or having attached there to a sign billboard or other media for advertising purposes such advertising being the prime purpose and use of the trailer trailer camping means a trailer as defined in this section equipped with an enclosure for sleeping while on vacation or other trips of short duration such camping trailers may also contain cooking bath and sanitary equipment trailer hauling means a trailer as defined in this section and designed and normally used for overtheroad transportation of belongings equipment merchandise livestock and other objects but not equipped for human habitation trailer park means a tract of land containing sites for overnight or short term parking of camping trailers vendor trailer means a trailer equipped for primary use as a portable location to vend or sell to the public either merchandise food or beverages  parking placing etc outside parks  temporary permit required it shall be unlawful for any person to park place or abandon any manufactured or mobile home on any street alley highway or any public place or upon any premises or tract of land located within the corporate limits of the city and which is situated outside a licensed manufactured or mobile home park or subdivision without first having secured a temporary permit as provided in this article  management of parks each manufactured or mobile home park shall be operated in a sanitary orderly and efficient manner and shall maintain a neat appearance at all times no damaged or deteriorated manufactured or mobile homes shall be permitted to remain and suitable and effective rules for regulating the outside storage of equipment the removal of wheels and installation of skirtings the collection of trash and garbage and the attachment of appurtenances to the manufactured or mobile homes shall be continually enforced all drives playground area and equipment lawn and trees and any recreation or accessory buildings shall be maintained at a level at least equal to the average residential neighborhood in the city all portions of the manufactured or mobile home park shall be open and accessible to fire police and other emergency and protective vehicles and personnel including city county and state inspectors  manufactured homes and trailers as nonresidential structures one or more manufactured homes or trailers may be used as a temporary office or other nonresidential structures on the site of a construction project provided such structures are removed upon completion of the project mobile structures may be used as temporary classroom facilities in connection with public schools with equivalent curriculum all structures in this section must file an application for temporary permit as provided in this article  manufactured home and modular home subdivisions when permitted a a subdivision for the purpose of selling individual lots in fee for the purpose of manufactured home or modular home sites may be permitted under chapter 56 b only doublewide or larger manufactured homes or customary singlefamily dwellings shall be permitted in such subdivisions such structures shall be located in compliance with the yard and lot area requirements of chapter 58 and shall be attached to a permanent concrete foundation or slab modular homes must be placed on a permanent foundation offstreet parking spaces shall be provided in compliance with chapter 58  nonconforming existing uses all manufactured home parks designated as manufactured home parks and having two or more spaces for rental of homes on  shall be considered existing mobile home parks and shall be exempt from all provisions of this article except that the electrical services within those manufactured home parks must comply with the provisions of this article and that no mobile homes see definitions will be allowed to move into these parks after the date of the ordinance from which this article is derived  location conditions manufactured home parks may be located in the city under the following conditions 1 a manufactured home park may be located in any part of the city  provided however that there is first obtained a special use permit for such location and a license therefore 2 each boundary of any manufactured home park must be at least 200 feet from any permanent residential building located outside said park unless separated there from by a natural or artificial barrier any artificial barrier must be at least five feet in height or unless a majority of the property owners owning property within 200 feet consent in writing to the establishment of said park  application for licenses and permits all applications for licenses and permits for manufactured homes and parks under this article shall be as follows 1 applications for temporary and permanent manufactured home park licenses as required by this article shall be filed at the office of the city clerk the application shall be in writing on forms provided by the city after inspection of the manufactured home park by the city clerk or his representative for conformance with the provisions of this article and upon the payment of the temporary or annual license fee as applicable in the amount provided in the city fee schedule the city clerk shall issue a license for one year 2 upon application for renewal of a manufactured home park license and after reinspection of said park by the city clerk or his representative for conformance with the provisions of this article and upon the payment of the annual license fee the city clerk shall issue a certificate renewing such license for another year  revocation of licenses if upon inspection of any manufactured home park the city clerk or his representative designated for this purpose finds that conditions exist which are in violation of any provisions of this article the city clerk shall give notices in writing to the person to whom the license was issued unless such condition or practices are corrected within a reasonable period of time to be determined by the codes enforcement officer he shall give notice in writing to the person to whom the license was issued that the license has been revoked upon receipt or the notice of revocation such person shall cease operation of said park all homes shall be removed within three months of the date of revocation of said park license  right to hearing on denial or revocation of licenses and permits any person whose application for a license occupancy permit or a temporary permit has been denied or any person whose license has been revoked may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter before the city council upon filing an application for a hearing before such body within ten days following the day upon which notice was received or such license or temporary permit was denied and the city council shall hold such hearing within 30 days after the filing of the application the filing of such application shall not suspend any order in denying approval for such license or temporary permit but shall suspend any order of revocation of the license until the matter has been determined by the city council  penalty a any person who shall neglect or refuse to comply with or shall violate or attempt to violate any of the provisions of this article or any amendments or additions thereto whether as owner agent officer employee tenant occupant lessee or any other person who shall permit or take part in or assist in such violation or attempted violation shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor constituting a separate offense for each and every day or portion thereof during which such violation is committed continued permitted or attempted and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided in section 111 b the imposition of the penalties herein prescribed shill not preclude the city or any other interested person from instituting injunction mandamus or other appropriate action or proceeding authorized by law to prevent correct or abate such violation  secs 26302646  reserved division 2  minimum standards for parks compliance with division required manufactured home parks shall conform to the minimum requirements set out in this division  site any manufactured home park shall he located on a site properly graded to ensure proper drainage and to prevent stagnant pools of water a stormwater plan drafted in accordance with section 5657 shall he submitted along with a site plan to the planning and zoning commission and the city council no such park shall have a site smaller than will accommodate 20 homes or comprising less than 313 acres the density will not exceed six mobile homes per acre  skirts each manufactured or mobile home shall be equipped with skirts on all sides such skirts to he of a material harmonious to the manufactured or mobile home structure  outdoor lockers each mobile home space shall be provided with a suitable outdoor locker of at least 50 cubic feet  open space each manufactured or mobile home shall he located on its space so that no part of one structure including canopies awnings carports and other protrusions is closer than 20 feet to another home or to the edge of the surface of a drive no home shall be located closer than 30 feet from any permanent building within the park or from any property line bounding the park  streets and drives all manufactured or mobile home spaces shall have adequate access to a driveway of not less than 27 feet in width which shall have unobstructed access to a public street or highway and shall not be by an alley all deadend driveways shall include adequate vehicular turning space or culdesac all private drives shall have portland cement curbs and he surfaced with at least six inches of compacted stone base with two inches of hot mix bituminous concrete as the surface course sealed within one year after completion or such other materials as may be approved by the codes enforcement officer  parking offdriveway parking shall be provided within 60 feet of the manufactured or mobile home and shall be maintained at a minimum ratio of two car spaces for each home space such parking spaces shall be off the public street or private drive and each shall be not less than nine feet by 20 feet in size and shall be surfaced to at least the standard set out above for drives  lighting all driveways and walkways within the manufactured home park shall be lighted at night with electric lamps with a luminous flux of not less than 2800 lm spaced at intervals of not more than 100 feet  or equivalent illumination as may be supplied by other approved sources  parks and playgrounds park and playground space shall be provided for the occupants of the manufactured or mobile home park on the basis of 500 square feet for each space in the park such playground space shall be separate and aside from the open space provided on each home space and shall be equipped and maintained for the use of the residents of the park the owner or operator shall be responsible for all maintenance upkeep and improvement of such areas  water supply all water supply and distribution systems shall be approved by the codes enforcement officer prior to construction the water supply shall be connected to the municipal water system and all plumbing shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the citys plumbing code individual water service connections shall be provided for direct use by manufactured or mobile homes and shall be so constructed that they will not be damaged by the parking of such homes or as required by the codes enforcement officer the owner of a manufactured or mobile home park may require individual water meters or a master meter for the entire water service in which case the owner shall be responsible for payment of the water bill and sewage service charge  sewage disposal all liquid waste shall be disposed of sanitary sewer system and treatment facility the plans of which shall be approved by the codes enforcement officer prior to construction all plumbing at the manufactured home park shall comply with state and local plumbing laws and regulations each home space shall be provided with at least a fourinch sewer connection the sewer connections shall be provided with suitable fittings so that a watertight connection can be made between the home drain and the sewer connection such individual home connections shall be so constructed that they can be closed when not linked to a home and shall be trapped in such a manner as to maintain them in an odorfree condition all sewer lines of the said park shall be connected to the public sewer system  refuse disposal all solid wastes shall be disposed of by accumulation in tight containers and removal at regular intervals by methods to be approved by the codes enforcement officer  electricity all electrical installations shall comply with the electrical code of the city electrical outlets shall be weatherproof an electrical outlet supplying at least 115 volts shall be provided for each manufactured home space with a minimum of 100 ampere individual service power lines including service lines to the homes may be either above ground or under ground and shall be installed in compliance with the standards of the utility corporation involved  fuel natural and liquefied petroleum gas for heating and cooking purposes may be used at individual manufactured home spaces  provided however that the installation is connected by copper or other suitable metallic tubing and complies with the citys fire prevention code  fire protection standards for fire protection use of portable fire extinguishers and location of fire hydrants in manufactured home parks shall be as follows 1 each such park shall be subject to the rules and regulations of the city and the citys fire prevention code 2 portable fire extinguishers of a type approved by the fire chief shall be kept in the service building and in such other buildings or locations named by the fire chief and shall be maintained at all times in a good operating condition 3 standard fire hydrants shall be located within 400 feet of each home  secs 26622680  reserved division 3  special use permits for parks required  prerequisites construction of a manufactured home park within the city shall begin only after a special use permit has been granted by the city council in compliance with chapter 58 no such permit shall be granted however until an application for a special use permit and a development plan for the proposed park have been prepared and submitted by the owner of the proposed manufactured park to the planning commission and found satisfactory to the city council with a recommendation for approval  application the application for a special use permit shall be in writing on forms provided by the city and shall be accompanied by a permit fee in the amount provided in the city fee schedule  development plan contents the development plan required by section 2681 shall be accurately drawn at a scale acceptable to the city engineer and shall show the following 1 proposed street and drive pattern 2 proposed manufactured homes spaces and their approximate dimensions 3 any existing streets in or shutting the property 4 location and size of parking spaces 5 location and size of park and playground area 6 screening and landscaping 7 legal description of the tract 8 plans and specifications of all buildings improvements and other facilities such as electrical wiring water service pipes gas service pipes and sewer service constructed or to be constructed within said park 9 name of the developer and the firm preparing the plan 10 north point scale and date 11 such other information as may be requested by the city planning commission to enable it to determine if the proposed park will comply with all the requirements of this article  publication of notice of application  hearing the city planning commission shall upon submission of three copies of the development plan an application for a special use permit and payment of all filing fees publish notice and hold a hearing on the proposal in conformance with chapter 58  criteria to be used regarding decision on application  submission to city council for final action a the decision of the city planning commission to recommend approval or denial of the proposed manufactured home park shall be based upon the following criteria 1 the proposed project will be in harmony in general with the citys comprehensive plan 2 compliance with minimum standards for said parks as set forth in this article b upon bearing and consideration of the project the city planning commission shall within reasonable time submit its recommendation and an endorsed copy of the development plan to the city council for final action  expiration after 24 months from the date of approval of a special use permit by the city council if the manufactured home park is not improved in accordance with the development plan to the extent that utilities surfaced drives and occupied homes spaces exist over at least 20 percent of the area of the approved park the special use permit shall expire and further development and additional occupancy of the park shall be prohibited all homes shall be removed within six months of the date of expiration of a special use permit the owner or his agent may apply for a new special use permit in the cause of expiration or cancellation under procedures set out in this division  secs 268726115  reserved division 4  individual occupancy permits required  application a it shall be unlawful for any person to park or place any each permit  secs 2613826154  reserved article iii  minimum design standards for recreational campgrounds division 1  generally compliance with division required recreational campgrounds shall conform to the minimum requirements set out in this division  definitions for the purpose of this division recreational vehicles and recreational campgrounds shall be defined as follows recreational vehicle means a vehicular type unit primarily designed as temporary living quarters for recreational camping or travel use which either has its own motive power or is mounted on or drawn by another vehicle the basic entities are travel trailer camping trailer truck camper and motor home recreational campgrounds means a plot of land upon which two or more recreational camping sites are located established or maintained for occupancy by recreational vehicles tents and recreational park trailers of the general public as temporary living quarters for recreation or vacation purposes no residential uses shall be permitted recreational campgrounds shall be designed to serve the placement of recreational vehicles tents and recreational park trailers tents shall not exceed 200 square feet in floor area and recreational park trailers shall not exceed 400 square feet in floor area the standards set forth under this section are intended for those recreational campgrounds where lots within the park are for rental and are to serve the shortterm placement of recreational vehicles and tents recreational park trailers may be permanently installed and shall be tied down and skirted tent means a temporary structure the covering of which is made of pliable material that achieves its support by mechanical means such as beams columns poles arches rope andor cables the term tent might also include a temporary tensionedmembrane structure recreational park trailer means a unit that meets all of the manufacturing standards of ansi a1195 and is certified by the recreational park trailer industry association inc trailer must be of sufficient width to require a special movement permit from the state of missouri and not exceed 400 square feet in size  permits in conjunction with the rules and regulations as herein specified the recreational campground developer shall submit properly prepared plans and specifications to the community development department such submission shall be in accordance with section 58149 after public hearing and review by the planning commission shall be reviewed and approved by the mayor and city council  secs 2615826174  reserved division 2  requirements plan requirements persons firms or corporations proposing to open a recreational campground shall not proceed with any construction work on the proposed park until they have obtained a special use permit from the city of pleasant hill as outlined in section 26140 1 preapplication procedure the recreational campground developer shall meet with the community development director prior to formal application to discuss his plans and shall prepare a suitable sketch and plans sufficient to give a general understanding of his proposal the community development director shall inform the developer as to the general suitability of the plans and of any modifications required by these regulations if deemed advisable 2 preliminary plan the developer shall then prepare and submit a preliminary plan together with improvement plans and other supplementary material as required where a recreational campground is proposed for construction in a series of stages a preliminary plan for development of the entire tract of land shall be submitted along with the detailed plans and specifications for the initial stage as well as any subsequent stages preliminary plans as required shall comply in form and content as follows insofar as applicable and the standard set forth herein 3 plan preparation requirements all applications to the planning commission shall contain the following a name mailing address legal address and telephone number of applicant b interest of the applicant in the proposed travel park c location address and legal description of the entire proposed travel park site d existing zoning of subject property and all adjacent properties e complete engineering plans and specifications of the proposed recreational campground showing 1 the area and dimensions of the entire tract of land  2 the land uses occupying the adjacent properties  3 the number size and location of the proposed vehicle sites and other parking areas  4 the location rightofway and surfaced roadway width roadway design data and walkways  5 the proposed interior vehicular and pedestrian circulation patterns  6 the location of service buildings sanitary stations and any other existing or proposed structures  7 the location of water and sewer lines and riser pipes  8 plans and specifications of all the water supply sewage disposal and refuse facilities  9 plans and specifications of all buildings constructed or to be constructed within the recreational campground  and 10 the location and details of area lighting electric and gas systems as related to all applicable codes and sound engineering practices 11 the location of all drainage easements 12 the location of prominent existing landscape features and proposed landscape features 4 soil erosion and sedimentation control plan the owner shall submit a soil erosion and sedimentation control plan such plan shall be prepared by a registered professional engineer and shall be as per the environment protection agencys requirements and shall be accordance with section 5670 of the subdivision regulations the plan shall be approved by the community development department prior to commencement of site preparation and construction 5 stormwater management plan the owner shall prepare and submit for review and approval a stormwater management plan to the community development department such plan shall indicate the proposed stormwater handling system proposed water retention and release schedule to eliminate the effects of uncontrolled water runoff on adjacent properties such plan shall conform with the stormwater regulations put forth in sections 5656 and 5657 of the subdivision regulations of the city of pleasant hill 6 commission action the planning and zoning commission shall review the preliminary park plan as submitted and within 90 days of submission shall take formal action on the plan in writing  giving its recommendations to the mayor and city council 7 nature of approval approval of a preliminary plan by the planning commission and zoning commission and the mayor and city council shall not constitute approval of the final plan or of roads or other improvements therein but is rather an expression of approval of the layout submitted on the preliminary plan as a guide to the preparation of the final plan 8 final plan upon completion of any modifications required by the planning and zoning commission and the mayor and council the developer may apply for approval of final plans final plans shall be approved by the planning and zoning commission and the mayor and city council  design requirements a lot area requirements the planning and location of individual recreational camping lots shall be governed by the following minimum requirements 1 lot area recreational vehicle lots and recreational park trailers shall have a minimum width of 30 feet and shall not be less than 1500 square feet  acres in total area such size is considered to accommodate parking for one recreational vehicle one automobile parking space an accessory structure and related outdoor facilities grill picnic tables benches etc maximum density per acre however shall not exceed 18 unitsgross acre tent sites shall not be less than 750 square feet in area 2 setback requirements front setback for recreational vehicle units shall be 15 feet from the front and side lot line of any internal road or street however structures such as bathhouses administration offices recreation centers and other ancillary facilities of a permanent nature shall be set back from adjacent or access streets 75 feet as measured from the centerline of such street in no case shall a recreational vehicle be closer than 15 feet from another recreational vehicle b perimeter requirements 1 when abutting residential districts a setback buffer area shall be 50 feet as measured from the park property line or zoning boundary line whichever may be applicable when abutting any other zoning district the setback shall be 25 feet as measured from the property line or zoning boundary line as may be applicable 2 when abutting an existing dedicated public rightofway the setback shall be 75 feet as measured from the street centerline or 25 feet from the existing rightofway whichever results in the greater setback 3 in no case shall a recreational vehicle be closer than 15 feet from another recreational vehicle c roadway design standards recreational campground roads shall be designed for the safe and convenient movement of recreational vehicles minimizing disturbance of the natural environment the internal street system shall be generally as outlined in article ii improvements and standards of design of the subdivision regulations of the city of pleasant hill and specifically as follows 1 streets design as per the latest version of the american public works associations standard specifications and design criteria all requirements for a public street shall be applicable such street shall serve as collector internal to the development and provide access to park lots administrative and ancillary facilities such collector streets shall be improved as outlined in the city of pleasant hills design and construction manual 2 parking spaces car parking spaces at a minimum size of ten by twenty feet shall be provided in sufficient number to meet the needs of the occupants of the property and their guests without interference with normal movement of traffic such facilities shall be provided at the rate of at least 112 parking spaces for each recreational vehicle lot and shall be on the recreational vehicle lot or in designated parking areas  no onstreet parking shall be permitted for safety reasons gravel may be used for off street parking surfaces 3 excavation and grading streets shall be excavated and graded as indicated on the approved plans this shall include excavation of the street to the lines grades and limits indicated on the drawings or as may be revised by the commission and the municipality to meet conditions encountered during construction the excavation for intersecting roadways stream channels and culverts within the approved rightofway limits  and shall also include the widening of cuts flattening and rounding of slopes outside the rightofway as called for on approved plans removal of the top soil and excavating of ditches and the construction of fill inspection shall be performed and approval granted by the municipality prior to further work d recreation at least ten percent of the park area shall be reserved for active and passive recreation purposes with appropriate location dimensions and topographic characteristics which lend themselves to recreational use such area shall exclude required buffer and setbacks e ancillary services the developer may include certain ancillary services such as laundromat camp store grocery store office bathhouse caretakers residence etc provided that such uses shall be strictly for the use and convenience of those persons utilizing the recreational campground and does not violate local zoning regulations the developer must have provide permanent rest rooms and a community storm shelter meeting fema publication 361 criteria f fire 1 general for the safety and welfare of the occupants of the recreational campgrounds the following fire regulations shall be incorporated into the park all fire safety plans shall be approved by the local designated fire chief of the municipality in which the park is located 2 fire hydrants shall hereafter be required in any new recreational campground where the extension of central water lines whether public or private are proposed for the recreational campground development a size and type hydrant size and type of all hydrants installed shall be of a standard size and type as specified by the municipality and the designated fire chief of the municipality in which the recreational campground is proposed to be located b spacing hydrant spacing shall be adequate to serve all lots within the recreational campground hydrants shall be arranged not more than 400 feet apart from one another when an existing hydrant is less than 400 feet from the park the existing hydrant shall be deemed satisfactory and spacing can be determined and shown taking the existing hydrant into consideration c location hydrants shall be located within dedicated easements d design the proposed locations of fire hydrants shall be shown on the submitted plans any existing fire hydrants less than 1000 feet from the proposed park shall be shown in the vicinity sketch with an exact distance in feet from the hydrant to the nearest lot line of the recreational campground g utilities all utilities shall be placed underground the placement of utilities shall conform to the citys codes and ordinances and the utility companys standards  secs 2617726183  reserved division 3  minimum operating standards for recreational them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning administer means the direct application of a drug or controlled substance whether by injection inhalation ingestion or any other means to the body of a patient or research subject by a practitioner or in his presence by his authorized agent or the patient or research subject at the direction and in the presence of the practitioner controlled substance means any drug or substance included in schedules i of the uniform controlled substances act found in rsmo ch 195 including but not limited to 1 cocaine and its derivatives 2 opiates and opium derivatives such as heroin codeine pethidine and morphine 3 hallucinogenic substances including lysergic acid diethylamide marijuana cannabis sativa l including seeds of mature plants mescaline psilocybin and various types of methoxyamphetamines 4 stimulants such as amphetamines and methamphetamines 5 barbiturates and other depressants such as amobarbital secobarbital pentobarbital phenobarbital methaqualone phencyclidine and diazepam deliver or delivery means the actual constructive or attempted transfer from one person to another of a drug paraphernalia or of a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance whether or not there is an agency relationship and includes a sale dispense means to deliver a drug or controlled substance to an ultimate user or research subject by or pursuant to the lawful order of a practitioner including the prescribing administering packaging labeling or compounding necessary to prepare the substance for such delivery distribute means to deliver other than by administering or dispensing a drug or controlled substance drug includes 1 substances recognized as drugs in the official united states pharmacopoeia official homeopathic pharmacopoeia of the united states or official national formulary or any supplement to any of them 2 substances intended for use in the diagnosis cure mitigation treatment or prevention of disease in man or animals 3 substances intended for use as a component of any article specified in this definition it does not include devices or their components parts or accessories drug paraphernalia 1 drug paraphernalia means all equipment products and materials of any kind which are used intended for use or designed for use in planting propagating cultivating growing harvesting manufacturing compounding converting producing processing preparing testing analyzing packaging repackaging storing containing concealing injecting ingesting inhaling or otherwise introducing into the human body a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance in violation of rsmo ch 195 it includes but is not limited to a kits used intended for use or designed for use in planting propagating cultivating growing or harvesting of any species of plant which is a controlled substance or from which a controlled substance can be derived b kits used intended for use or designed for use in manufacturing compounding converting producing processing or preparing controlled substances or imitation controlled substances c isomerization devices used intended for use or designed for use in increasing the potency of any species of plant which is a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance d testing equipment used intended for use or designed for use in identifying or in analyzing the strength effectiveness or purity of controlled substances or imitation controlled substances e scales and balances used intended for use or designed for use in weighing or measuring controlled substances or imitation controlled substances f diluents and adulterants such as quinine hydrochloride mannitol mannite dextrose and lactose used intended for use or designed for use in cutting controlled substances or imitation controlled substances g separation gins and sifters used intended for use or designed for use in removing twigs and seeds from or in otherwise cleaning or refining marijuana h blenders bowls containers spoons and mixing devices used intended for use or designed for use in compounding controlled substances or imitation controlled substances i capsules balloons envelopes and other containers used or intended for use in packaging small quantities of controlled substances or imitation controlled substances j containers and other objects used intended for use or designed for use in storing or concealing controlled substances or imitation controlled substances k hypodermic syringes needles and other objects used or intended for use in parenterally injecting controlled substances or imitation controlled substances into the human body l objects used or intended for use in ingesting inhaling or otherwise introducing marijuana cocaine hashish or hashish oil into the human body such as 1 metal wooden acrylic glass stone plastic or ceramic pipes with or without screens permanent screens hashish heads or punctured metal bowls 2 water pipes 3 carburetion tubes and devices 4 smoking and carburetion masks 5 roach clips meaning objects used to hold burning material such as a marijuana cigarette that has become too small or too short to be held in the hand 6 miniature cocaine spoons and cocaine vials 7 chamber pipes 8 carburetor pipes 9 electric pipes 10 airdriven pipes 11 chillums 12 bongs 13 ice pipes or chillers 2 in determining whether an object is drug paraphernalia a court or other authority should consider in addition to all other logically relevant factors the following a statements by an owner or by anyone in control of the object concerning its use b prior convictions if any of an owner or of anyone in control of the object under any state or federal law relating to any controlled substance or imitation controlled substance c the proximity of the object in time and space to a direct violation of this article d the proximity of the object to controlled substances or imitation controlled substances e the existence of any residue of controlled substances or imitation controlled substances on the object f direct or circumstantial evidence of the intent of an owner or of anyone in control of the object to deliver it to persons who he knows or reasonably should know intend to use the object to facilitate a violation of this article  the innocence of an owner or of anyone in control of the object as to a direct violation of this article shall not prevent a finding that the object is intended for use as drug paraphernalia g instructions oral or written provided with the object concerning its use h descriptive materials accompanying the object which explain or depict its use i national and local advertising concerning its use j the manner in which the object is displayed for sale k direct or circumstantial evidence of the ratio of sales of the object to the total sales of the business enterprise l the existence and scope of legitimate uses for the object in the community m expert testimony concerning its use imitation controlled substance means a substance that is not a controlled substance which by dosage unit appearance including color shape size and markings or by representations made would lead a reasonable person to believe that the substance is a controlled substance in determining whether the substance is an imitation controlled substance the court or authority concerned should consider in addition to all other logically relevant factors the following 1 whether the substance was approved by the federal food and drug administration for overthecounter nonprescription or nonlegend sales and was sold in the federal food and drug administration approved package with the federal food and drug administration approved labeling information 2 statements made by an owner or by anyone else in control of the substance concerning the nature of the substance or its use or effect 3 whether the substance is packaged in a manner normally used for illicit controlled substances 4 prior convictions if any of an owner or anyone in control of the object under state or federal law related to controlled substances or fraud 5 the proximity of the substances to controlled substances 6 whether the consideration tendered in exchange for the noncontrolled substance substantially exceeds the reasonable value of the substance considering the actual chemical composition of the substance and where applicable the price at which overthecounter substances of like chemical composition sell an imitation controlled substance does not include a noncontrolled substance that was initially introduced in commerce prior to the initial introduction into commerce of the controlled substance which it is alleged to imitate furthermore an imitation controlled substance does not include a placebo or registered investigational drug either of which was manufactured distributed possessed or delivered in the ordinary course of professional practice or research license or licensed means persons required to obtain annual registration as issued by the state division of health as provided by rsmo  manufacture means the production preparation propagation compounding conversion or processing of drug paraphernalia or of a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance either directly or indirectly by extraction from substances of natural origin or independently by means of chemical synthesis or by a combination of extraction and chemical synthesis and includes any packaging or repackaging of the substance or labeling or relabeling of its container except that this term does not include the preparation or compounding of a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance by an individual for his own use or the preparation compounding packaging or labeling of a narcotic or dangerous drug by a practitioner as an incident to his administering or dispensing of a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance in the course of his professional practice  or by a practitioner or by his authorized agent under his supervision for the purpose of or as an incident to research teaching or chemical analysis and not for sale marijuana 1 the term marijuana means all parts of all varieties of the plant cannabis whether growing or not the seeds thereof the resin extracted from any part of the plant and every compound manufacture salt derivative mixture or preparation of the plant its seeds or resin 2 for purposes of this section marijuana is also botanically known as cannabis sativa cannabis indica commonly called indian hemp mexican hemp marijuana muggles mooter or any drug or preparation made from any species or variety of the botanical genus cannabis or any compound derivative or preparation of the abovementioned plant 3 it does not include the mature stalks of the plant fiber produced from the stalks oil or cake made from the seeds of the plant any other compound manufacture salt derivative mixture or preparation of the mature stalks except the resin extracted therefrom fiber oil or cake or the sterilized seed of the plant which is incapable of germination pharmacist means an individual currently licensed by the state board to practice the profession of pharmacy in this state practitioner means a physician dentist podiatrist as defined in rsmo ch 330 or course of professional practice or research in this state or a pharmacy hospital or other institution licensed registered or otherwise permitted to distribute dispense conduct research with respect to or administer a controlled substance in the course of professional practice or research in this state prescription means a written order and in cases of emergency a telephone order issued by a practitioner in good faith in the course of his professional practice to a pharmacist for a drug for a particular patient which specifies the date of its issue the name and address of the patient and if such drug is prescribed for an animal the species of such animal the name and quantity of the drug prescribed the directions for use of such drug and the signature of such practitioner production includes the manufacture of drug paraphernalia or the manufacture planting cultivation growing or harvesting of a controlled substance or an imitation controlled substance warehouseman means a person who in the usual course of business stores drugs for others lawfully entitled to possess them and who has no control over the disposition of such drugs except for the purpose of such storage wholesaler means a person who supplies drug paraphernalia or controlled substances or imitation controlled substances that he himself has not produced or prepared on official written orders but not on prescriptions  state law reference similar provisions rsmo  prohibited acts  exemptions a no person shall sell give away manufacture use or possess for any purpose whatever any controlled substance except as provided herein b distribution by licensed practitioners is permitted under the following conditions 1 practitioners a licensed practitioner shall be permitted to dispense or distribute controlled substances and drugs to a person in the course of his professional practice only  and such licensed practitioner shall not be permitted to possess controlled substances for any other purpose 2 pharmacists a licensed pharmacist shall be permitted to dispense or distribute controlled substances and drugs to persons under and in pursuance of written prescriptions issued by any licensed practitioner  and such licensed pharmacist shall not be permitted to possess controlled substances for any other purpose 3 record of distribution all instances of professional distribution of controlled substances and drugs as provided for herein shall be recorded in suitable form and filed and preserved in a manner so as to be readily accessible for inspection by any law enforcement officer of the city 4 renewal prohibited no prescription for controlled substances shall be renewed or refilled c any person shall be permitted to possess controlled substances distributed or dispensed to him under the provisions of this section but such possession and use must be in accordance with the prescription and prescribed treatment d a person who is a licensed manufacturer warehouseman or wholesaler of controlled substances shall be permitted to possess controlled substances for the purposes of wholesale delivery compounding preparation and manufacture only  and the same shall only be resold to other persons permitted by this section to resell or dispense or distribute controlled substances in the course of a licensed manufacturing or wholesale business  a licensed professional practice or a licensed pharmaceutical business a licensed manufacturer or wholesaler permitted to possess controlled substances in this subsection may also be a licensed pharmacist and may dispense or distribute narcotic drugs upon written prescription as provided herein but shall not consume or permit to be consumed any controlled substances except upon written overt act in pursuance of such conspiracy is alleged and proved to have been done by him or by a person with whom he conspired a person may not be convicted of conspiracy if after conspiring to commit the offense he prevented the accomplishment of the objectives of the conspiracy under circumstances manifesting a renunciation of his criminal purpose and has either advised those with whom he has conspired of his abandonment or has informed the law enforcement authorities of the existence of the conspiracy and his participation in it c if a person conspires to commit a number of offenses he is guilty of only one conspiracy so long as such multiple offenses are the object of the same agreement d a person may not be convicted or sentenced on the basis of the same course of conduct of both the actual commission of an offense and a conspiracy to commit that offense e for the purpose of any applicable statute of limitations a conspiracy is a continuing course of conduct which terminates when the offenses which are its object are committed or the agreement that they be committed is abandoned by the defendant and by those with whom he conspired f in determining whether any person is guilty of conspiracy a court or other authority may consider in addition to all other logically relevant factors whether the individual charged 1 provided materials necessary for the commission of any et seq back division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning acts knowingly means that a person acts 1 with respect to his conduct or attendant circumstances when he is aware of the nature of his conduct or that those circumstances exist  or 2 with respect to a result of his conduct when he is aware that his conduct is practically certain to cause that result acts purposely means that a person acts with purpose with respect to his conduct or to a result thereof when it is his conscious object to engage in that conduct or to cause that result acts recklessly means a person acts recklessly or is reckless when he consciously disregards a substantial or unjustifiable risk that circumstances exist or that a result will follow and such disregard constitutes a gross deviation from the standard of care which a reasonable person would exercise in the situation acts with criminal negligence means that a person acts when he fails to be aware of a substantial and unjustifiable risk that circumstances exist or a result will follow and such failure constitutes a gross deviation from the standard of care which a reasonable person would exercise in the situation loitering means remaining idle in essentially one decibel meter b notwithstanding subsection 5a of this section the council shall have the right to issue special permits allowing outdoor activities with noise levels exceeding the above limits causes physical injury to another person by means of a deadly weapon or dangerous instrument  or he purposely places another person in apprehension of immediate physical injury  or he recklessly engages in conduct which creates a grave risk of death or serious physical injury to another person  or he knowingly causes physical contact with another person knowing the other person will regard is a defense only if 1 the physical injury consented to or threatened by the conduct is not serious physical injury  2 the conduct and the harm are reasonably foreseeable hazards of the victims   assaults and domestic violence a policy it is the policy of the city to handle offenses involving acts of violence against persons in an expedient and decisive manner it is the purpose of this policy to prevent additional violence in the incident to discourage repeated acts of violence by the same offender to assist victims in pursuing charges against violent offenders and to reduce the risk to officers responding to incidents of acts of violence against a person b definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abuse means any act which would constitute assault battery coercion harassment sexual assault or unlawful imprisonment act of violence means any act which involves the infliction of physical harm bodily injury or assault the use of a weapon or dangerous instrument against a person holding or transporting a person against that persons will and without legal justification  threats to cause injury commit assault or use a weapon or dangerous instrument against any person  any act of abuse which is in violation of an order of protection  or any act which would reasonably cause a person in the position of the victim to fear the imminent infliction of physical harm bodily injury or assault an act of violence against a person also includes those acts which constitute the crimes of murder manslaughter assault sexual offenses robbery arson armed criminal action weapons offenses robbery arson armed criminal action weapons offenses arson and some instances of peace disturbance and property damage domestic violence means the infliction of abuse or an act of violence against a person by one family or household member upon another familyhousehold member means persons who are spouses former spouses persons related by blood or marriage persons who are presently residing together or have resided together in the past and persons who have a child in common regardless of whether they have been married or have resided together at any time the term familyhousehold member includes commonlaw marriages same sex couples different generations of the same family siblings and inlaws multiple offenders if when responding to a call involving an act of violence against a person the officer is informed that more than one party has committed an act of violence against a person the responding officer will determine which party is the primary physical abuser the officer will then determine whether arrest of the primary physical abuser should occur based upon the considerations set out above in determining which person is the primary physical abuser the officer may take into consideration the intent of the law to protect victims of violence from further violence the comparative extent of injuries inflicted or threats of violence the history of violence between the parties the relationship of the parties the relative size and strength of the parties and whether or not any party has an order of protection or a restraining order against any other party when making an arrest determination the officer may disregard any injuries which it reasonably appears to the officer were inflicted in selfdefense under no circumstances may an officer threaten to arrest both parties in an attempt to discourage a request for intervention from one of the parties offense reports officers responding to a report of an act of violence against a person will complete an offense report for each incident in which an act of violence against a person has been alleged the victim will be given information on how to obtain a copy of the report if no arrest was made on the incident the reporting officer will note in the report a complete description of the offending party the victims name time address reason why no arrest was made and any other pertinent information when injuries are visible on the victim or there are obvious signs of a struggle the reporting officer will attempt to document visual evidence with photographs if possible computer files will be updated with information on each call involving an alleged act of violence against a person where officers are dispatched to the scene all incidents which are incidents of domestic violence will be so identified by the code dv copies of offense reports involving incidents for which arrests were made will be filed on a daily basis for inspection by recognized local shelters andor victim advocate groups c regulations 1 response an officer will respond immediately to any report of an act of violence against a person when the caller reports or the officer has reason to believe that violence is imminent or in progress previous acts of violence have occurred between the parties or an order of protection is in effect 2 response at scene the responding officer will request to talk to the alleged victim out of the hearing and view of the alleged offender if access to the alleged victim is denied the alleged offender will be informed that refusal to allow access to the victim can be considered an exigent circumstances justifying a warrantless entry into the premises 3 arrest an officer will effect an arrest when the officer has probable cause to believe that an act of violence against a person has occurred and that a the victim has sustained physical injury  b an order of protection is in effect  c there are valid warrants or computer warrants on file  d such arrest is necessary to prevent further acts of violence  or e the call is the second call in 12 hours to the same address for which the responding officer has had probable cause to believe that an act of violence against a person has occurred if the offender is not at the scene an immediate investigative effort will be made by the officer to effect the required arrest 4 warrantless arrest an officer may arrest without a warrant any person the officer sees committing an act of violence against a person or who the officer has probable cause to believe has committed such an act d additional regulations and procedures applicable when an order of protection is in effect 1 arrest an officer will arrest any person who commits an act of abuse in violation of a full order of protection or who violates an ex parte order of protection of which the person has notice such violations are class d felonies under state law in addition an officer will arrest any person who is in any location in violation of an order of protection or who has retained physical custody of children in violation of an order of protection 2 notice of service an officer will give any person against whom an ex parte order of protection has been issued notice of the order by handing a copy of the order to such person copies of the order to be used for the purpose are issued by the court to the person obtaining the order once the officer has handed the copy of the ex parte order to the person against whom it was issued the officer will date time sign and write his department serial number on the back of the gold carbon copy of the order which is retained by the victim if the victim does not have an extra copy of the order to give to the offender the officer will orally inform the offender of the existence of the order and its contents and indicate that oral notice was given on the victims copy of the order in the same manner as set out above 3 missouri uniform law enforcement system mules information on each order of protection received from the associate circuit or circuit court will be entered on mules no later than 24 hours after issuance of the order 4 child custody rsmo  requires officers to arrest any party who is in violation of any child custody order issued under the adult abuse act rsmo  et seq an officer responding to an incident in which it is alleged that a violation of the custody provisions of an ex parte order of protection has occurred will after notice of the ex parte order is given direct the person holding the child or children to surrender the child or children to the person to whom custody was given failure or refusal to make such surrender is a violation of state law mandating arrest 5 entry of dwelling if an abuser has been ordered in an order of protection not to enter a specified dwelling for any reason or in the case of an ex parte order failure or refusal to leave after notice constitutes a violation of the order of protection e procedures 1 receipt and dispatch of calls any dispatch employee or officer receiving notification of an act of violence against a person will give highest priority to the safety of the victim which may include but is not limited to the following a assuming the presence of violence from the conduct of the caller  b calling back when the behavior of the caller changes markedly during the call  or c dispatching officers to the scene without having obtained all the information normally obtained for dispatch a dispatcher receiving a call involving an act of violence against a person will listen for background noises that assist in evaluating the threat level screams shots threats breaking glass or furniture the dispatcher will check police records to determine whether or not an order of protection is in effect  or there have been previous reports of violence involving the same offender and will advise the responding officers of the information obtained from this check 2 entry into private dwelling an officer may enter into a private dwelling upon consent of any person residing therein or by any person having authority to consent to such entry or when exigent circumstances exist factors which may be considered by the officer in determining whether exigent circumstances exist are the responding officer has reason to believe that violence is imminent or in progress  the person reporting the incident has indicated that violence is imminent or in progress  the alleged offender will not allow access to the alleged victim for purposes of verifying whether or not violence is imminent or in progress  there are cries for help  there are obvious signs of a struggle or an eyewitness to a struggle and the victim is still on or assumed to be on the premises  or the officer has probable cause to believe the offender is on the premises and armed with a weapon or dangerous instrument a responding officer may determine that exigent circumstances exist in other circumstances based on the officers reasonable evaluation of the situation when refused entry to a residence an officer may a enter the premises if exigent circumstances as set out above exist b contact the dispatcher and ask the dispatcher to attempt to contact the caller for further information c contact a supervisor for further direction d conduct a neighborhood canvas for further information regarding the incident or the circumstances of the parties e remain at the scene remove to a public spot and observe the premises in deciding whether or not to enter a premises the responding officer will balance the degree of urgency involved with the time required to obtain a warrant when an officer has entered a premises without consent the officer must state in his written report the exigent circumstances which were deemed to exist justifying the forced entry 3 probable cause the determination of whether probable cause exists for arrest of a person for an act of violence against a person will be based on the same factors as would be used to determine the existence of probable cause in similar incidents a in determining whether probable cause exists officers will keep in mind that injuries although present may not be readily visible and that victims of violence may not show the expected emotional response b a victims willingness to sign a complaint is a factor in determining probable cause however it is not necessary for the victim to sign a complaint if the officer has probable cause to believe the offense occurred regardless of the victims desire to prosecute if an arrest is made the victim will be issued a subpoena if there is doubt in the officers mind a supervisor will be consulted c lack of probable cause cannot be based upon considerations such as the potential financial consequences of the arrest to any party verbal assurances that violence will cease the fact that the parties are family or household members see section 28302 that the victim has failed to pursue prosecution in previous instances of violence or that the victim may not appear in court to testify 4 gathering evidence physical evidence in an act of violence against a person will be collected in the same manner as physical evidence in all other investigations in addition a officers may obtain color photographs of victims injuries when the injuries are visible photographs may be taken by an officer of the same sex as the victim when the injuries are situated on a part of the body that is not normally visible b photographing the scene of the incident to show any signs of a struggle is preferred but if not possible a written description of the scene will be included in the officers report of the incident c witnesses to the incident will be interviewed as soon as possible if witnesses provide information about prior acts of violence between the parties or by the same offender document the prior acts to establish a pattern d children will be interviewed with care and understanding children will be observed for signs of trauma and abuse 5 interviewing the victim the responding officer will contact the victim of the incident out of the hearing of the alleged offender to determine the following information a the nature of the incident b whether the victim has any injuries c whether an order of protection or a restraining order is in effect d whether a weapon or a threat to use a weapon was involved in the incident e whether there have been previous acts of violence between the parties f whether the offender has ever committed an act of violence or threatened to commit an act of violence against any other person officers should remember that victims of violence may not respond in the expected manner and may themselves appear agitated or not under control the responding officer will interview the victim in such a manner as to minimize stress on the victim the responding officer will inform the victim of the legal procedure following an arrest the responding officer will inform a victim of domestic violence of the availability of orders of protection free legal assistance and where appropriate of the availability of shelters for battered women and their children 6 assisting the victim a officers will protect the victim from further abuse they will separate the victim from the offender administer first aid and arrange for medical attention if the victim is hurt b the victim may have sustained injuries which are not readily visible either because they are too recent in time or are located in areas covered by clothing officers will question the victim to determine the possibility of injuries which are not readily visible if medical care is necessary the officer will arrange for transportation of the victim to a medical facility c if the victim appears to be injured and refuses medical assistance carefully document any observed injuries as well as the refusal of medical treatment d the officer at a scene involving domestic violence will inform the abused party of available judicial remedies for relief from adult abuse and of available shelters for victims of domestic violence e a victim of domestic violence who wishes to seek shelter for battered women will be transported to the police building or to another place of safety to make arrangements for such shelter f officers will remain at the scene for a reasonable time to insure that there is no further threat of injury to the victim officers may remain at the scene for fifteen minutes to allow the victim to collect and remove essential items of personal property such as personal records birth certificates checkbooks credit cards wallet or purse and personal clothing if additional standby time appears to be reasonably needed the officer will contact the officers supervisor for permission to remain on standby for additional fifteen minute increments 7 child custody when the offender and the victim have children together who are present at the scene where an act of violence against a person has been alleged such children will be left with the person having an order of custody for the children from a court or if no such order exists the nonviolent parent unless there is good cause for the officer to retain temporary protective custody of the child in no event may an officer threaten to retain custody of a child for the sole purpose of discouraging a victim from pursuing an allegation of an act of violence against a person f bond 1 arrests for an act of violence against a person carry a bond of $25000 2 arrests for an act of violence against a person carry a bond of $50000 when any one of the following factors is present a injuries b threats to use a weapon or dangerous instrument c repeat calls d an order of protection is in effect 3 arrests for an act of violence against a person carry a bond of $100000 when there are serious injuries when a weapon or dangerous instrument has been used or when any two of the factors shown above are present 4 if an officer believes the circumstances warrant a higher bond a municipal court judge will be contacted for authorization of a higher bond 5 only the municipal court judge or associate circuit or circuit court judge are authorized to release a person arrested for an act of violence against a person on a signature bond    12191989 secs 2830328311
