dedicated and all extensions thereof and additions thereto in the city poles wires cables underground conduits manholes and other cable conductors and fixtures necessary for the maintenance and operation in the city of a cable communications system to be used for the sale and distribution of cable services to the residences of the city said broad band cable service shall include but shall not be limited to the carriage of television and radio signals and any cable casting programming b the grantee shall at all times during the operation of this franchise be subject to all lawful exercise of the police power as may be hereafter provided by the franchising authority c the franchise area is for the city limits as presently defined cable service shall be made available to the entire franchise area in accordance with the construction timetable contained in section 5 of this ordinance duration of franchise  renewal a the duration of the rights privileges and authorizations hereby granted shall be 15 years from the effective date of this ordinance b this franchise may be renewed or extended by the council upon application of the grantee in accordance with the then existing rules of the federal communications commission and applicable law renewal or extension of the franchise shall be considered in a full public proceeding affording due process during which the performance of the grantee and the adequacy of the franchise ordinance will be reviewed nothing in this provision shall be construed to require such renewal or extension  however decision upon such renewal or extension may not be unreasonably withheld or delayed commencement and completion of construction the grantee must within 150 days from the date it obtains all necessary pole agreements from utility companies commence construction of the system and have said system operating within 12 months from the commencement of construction if said system is not in operation within 12 months from the commencement of construction the franchise may be cancelled at the option of the city transfer of control no transfer of control of the cable system shall take place whether by forced or voluntary sale lease mortgage assignment encumbrance or any other form of disposition without prior notice to and approval by the council which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld nothing contained herein shall be deemed to prohibit the assignment of the franchise or mortgage of the grantees property for financing purposes subject to the rights of the city under this ordinance such requisite approval shall not be unreasonably delayed or withheld rates a the initial basic service rates and charges inclusive of the franchise fee but exclusive of any federal state or local taxes which may be made by grantee for connections and service rendered by it to the inhabitants of the city shall be as set forth on exhibit a which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference these rates shall remain in effect for a period of at least two years from the effective date of this ordinance b the grantee shall have the right to set subscriber rates and charges for cable television service within the franchise area granted herein provided that at least 60 days prior to the date of anticipated change in basic subscriber rates and charges is to go into effect grantee must notify the city and file current financial statements certified by a certified public accountant based on assets and liability allocated by miles of cable plant and the profit and loss statement allocated by the number of basic subscribers if the council thereafter chooses to hold a public proceeding prior to the date of the anticipated change in basic subscriber rates and charges is to go into effect a representative of grantee shall be required to appear at said public proceeding on behalf of grantee in order to answer any inquiries relating to the anticipated increase in basic subscriber rates and charges if the council chooses to conduct a public proceeding it shall be expeditious and the council shall approve the rates proposed so long as they are fair and reasonable based upon actual expenses of the grantee including a fair and reasonable return on the original cost less depreciation of the properties devoted to such service the rates shall go into effect if not made subject to a public proceeding by the council within 60 days after grantees notification of the anticipated change c the grantee shall collect no money from the inhabitants of the city until grantees system is operable  5121981 payment to the city for the use of the streets and other facilities of the city for the operation of the cable communication system and for the supervision thereof charge shall be paid quarterly to the city and shall be adjusted annually based on grantees year end financial statements submitted by grantee and by a certified public accountant the city is hereby and records for the grantees system serving the city upon reasonable notice to grantee additionally grantee shall reimburse the city for its actual and reasonable expenses incurred in the initial granting of this franchise and during the period of monitoring construction including and limited to engineering costs permits and attorneys fees each expense shall be submitted to grantee with an procedures a all transmissions and distribution structures lines and equipment erected by the grantee within the city shall be so located as to cause minimum interference with the rights and reasonable convenience of property owners who join any of the said streets b in case of disturbance of any street or paved area the grantee shall at its own cost and expense in a manner approved by the city replace and restore such street or paved area in as good a condition as before the work involving such disturbance was done c if any time during the period of the franchise the city shall lawfully elect to alter or change the grade of any street the grantee upon reasonable notice by the city shall remove relay and relocate its poles wires cables underground conduits manholes and other fixtures at its own expense d any poles or other fixtures placed in or adjacent to any street by the grantee shall be placed in such manner as to comply with all requirements of the city e the grantee shall at the request of any person holding a moving permit issued by the city temporarily raise or lower its wires to permit the moving of buildings the expense of such temporary removal or raising or lowering of wires shall be paid by the person requesting the same and the grantee shall have the authority to require such payment in advance the grantee shall be given not less than 48 hours advance notice to arrange for such temporary wire changes f the grantee shall have the authority to trim trees upon and over hanging streets of the city so as to prevent the branches of the trees from coming in contact with the wires and cables of the grantee except that at the option of the city such trimming may be done by it or under its supervision and direction at the expense of the grantee g in all sections of the city where the cables wires or other like facilities of public utilities are placed underground the grantee shall place its cables wires or other like facilities underground h on expiration of the terms for which the franchise is granted or upon its termination and cancellation as provided for herein the city shall have the right to require the grantee to remove at its own expense all portions of the television cable system from all streets within this city i the grantees system poles wires and appurtenances shall be located erected and maintained so that none of its facilities shall endanger or interfere with the lives of persons or interfere with any improvements the city may deem proper to make or unnecessarily hinder or obstruct the free use of the streets alleys bridges easements or public property j the construction operation and maintenance of the system by grantee shall be in full compliance with such portions of the national building and electrical indemnification it is expressly understood and agreed by and between the city and any grantee hereunder that the grantee shall save the city and its agents and employees harmless from and against all claims damages losses and expenses including reasonable attorneys fees sustained by the city on account of any suit judgment execution claim or demand whatsoever arising out of but not limited to copyright infringements and all other damages arising out of the installation operation or maintenance of the cable system authorized herein whether or not any act of negligence or omission complained of may appear to be authorized allowed or prohibited by this ordinance and any franchise granted hereunder service standards a the grantee shall put keep and maintain all parts of the system in good condition throughout the entire franchise period b upon termination of service to any subscriber the grantee shall promptly remove all its facilities and equipment from the premises of such subscriber upon his request c the grantee shall render efficient service make repairs promptly and interrupt service only for good cause and for the shortest time possible such interruptions insofar as possible shall be preceded by notice and shall occur during periods of minimum system use d the grantee shall not allow its cable or other operations to interfere with television reception of persons not served by grantee nor shall the system interfere with obstruct or hinder in any manner the operation of the various utilities serving the residents of the city e the facilities used by grantee shall be capable of distributing color tv signals and when the signals grantee distributes are received in color they shall be distributed in color where technically feasible f the grantee shall produce a picture whether in black and white or in color that is undistorted free from ghost images and accompanied with proper sound on typical standard production tv sets in good repair and as good as the state of the art allows g the grantee shall transmit signals of adequate strength to produce good pictures with good sound at all outlets without causing cross modulation in the cables or interfering with other electrical or electronic systems complaint procedure a the grantee shall maintain an office in independence missouri for the purpose of receiving and resolving all complaints regarding the quality of service equipment malfunctions and other related matters grantee further agrees to establish a local point in pleasant hill missouri for payment of subscribers fees  and grantee agrees to review the need for a local office for filing of complaints on a regular basis with the understanding that future growth of the subscriber base in pleasant hill missouri may require the maintenance of such a local office in pleasant hill missouri grantee further agrees to maintain a tollfree telephone number for subscribers use in making inquiries and complaints 24 hours per day seven days per week b the grantee shall maintain a repair and maintenance crew capable of responding to subscriber complaints or requests for service within 48 hours after receipt of the complaint or request no charge shall be made to the subscriber for this service  5121981 right of revocation a the council shall have the right to rescind or revoke the rights herein granted upon any violation by the grantee of any material obligation or requirement contained herein or upon the refusal to comply with any reasonable request made by the council concerning compliance with this ordinance after written notice by the franchising authority to the grantee and continuation of such violation or refusal to comply by the grantee b such written notice to the grantee shall specify precisely the manner in which the grantee is in violation with respect to the franchise the notice shall specify a reasonable amount of time within which the grantee must correct the violation but in no event shall the time period be less than 30 days from the date of receipt of the notice to the grantee c in the event the grantee shall be adjudicated bankrupt or placed in receivership the city may be by resolution declare this franchise herein granted to be forfeited and terminated preferential or discriminatory practices prohibited the grantee shall not as to rates charges services services facilities rules regulations employment or in any other respect make or grant any undue preference or advantage to any party nor subject any party to any prejudice or disadvantage because of sex race color creed or national located only as permitted in section 7 hereof franchisee understands it shall be obligated to make its own arrangements for the use of any private streets ways or easements located in the franchise area the franchise granted under the terms and conditions contained herein shall be consistent with federal laws and regulations and state general laws and regulations in the event of conflict between the terms and conditions of the franchise and the terms and conditions on which the city can grant a franchise the general law andor statutory requirements shall without exception control the authority hereby granted to conduct a cable communication system within the franchise area and to use and to occupy the streets and ways thereof to the extent dedicated to the public does not and shall not be deemed an exclusive right or permission and the city expressly reserves the right to grant additional nonexclusive franchises to persons firms corporations or other business organizations to construct operate and maintain cable communication systems within the franchise area but only on dedicated streets ways and easements  but no such additional franchise shall be more favorable or less burdensome than this franchise and no such franchise shall in any way affect or lessen the rights or obligations of the franchisee herein term of franchise the franchise privilege and authority herein granted shall take effect upon filing of acceptance within 30 days by the franchisee and shall continue force and effect for a term of 15 years after the effective date of this franchise the franchise may be renewed for an additional time period upon the approval of the governing body of the city based upon a reasonable determination that the franchisee has met the terms of the franchise and provided satisfactory service to its customers in all instances renewals shall be subject to and in compliance with the provisions of the cable communications policy act of 1984 the cable act as amended as well as state and federal law the franchisee shall submit its request to renew the franchise at least one year prior to its expiration compliance with fcc and state regulations the franchisee shall comply with any and all regulations and technical standards promulgated by the fcc or other appropriate federal or state regulatory bodies with regard to its operation in the franchise area and in regard to its conduct under this franchise the cable act and the rules and regulations of the fcc are incorporated into this franchise as of the date of its adoption and any lawful modification resulting from the amendment of the cable act and the rules and regulations of the fcc shall be incorporated into this franchise as of the date such modification becomes obligatory under the cable act and the fcc rules and regulations or in the event no obligatory date is established within one year of adoption or at the time of franchise renewal whichever occurs first other authority this franchise authorizes the operation of a cable communications system and service as provided for herein and does not take the place of any other franchise license or permit which might be required by the law conditions of street occupancy a all transmission and distribution structures lines and equipment maintained by the franchisee within the franchise area shall be located so as not to cause any unreasonable interference with the proper use of streets and other public ways and places and to cause minimum interference with the rights and reasonable convenience of property owners who adjoin any such street or other public ways and places the system shall be constructed and operated in compliance with city state and national construction and electrical codes in effect on the date this ordinance is adopted and shall be kept current with new codes as they are adopted as necessary to maintain the safety of the public the franchisee shall maintain its wires cables fixtures and other equipment in such manner that they will not unreasonably interfere with any installation of the city or of a public utility serving the city b in case of disturbance of any street public way or paved areas as a result of the operation of the franchisee the franchisee shall at its own cost and expense replace and restore such street public way or paved area to as nearly as possible as good a condition as before the work involving such disturbance was done within a period of ten days in case any obstruction caused by the franchisee shall remain longer than 30 days after notice to remove it or in the case of neglect by the franchisee to safeguard any dangerous places the city may remove such obstruction or safeguard such dangerous places at the expense of the franchisee unless the franchisee provides the city written evidence that corrective action has been taken or is being actively pursued with reasonable diligence c any fixtures placed in any street or public way by the franchisee shall be placed in such manner as not to interfere with the usual travel on such street or public way d the franchisee at its expense shall protect support temporarily disconnect relocate along under or over any street or public place or remove from any street or public place any of franchisees equipment or facilities when reasonably required by the city for reasons including but not limited to traffic conditions public safety street excavation freeway or street construction change or establishment of street grade installations of sewers drains water pipes or any other type of structures or improvements by the city acting in a governmental or in a proprietary capacity this provision shall be inapplicable to rearrangements of facilities not located in the public rightofway e the franchisee upon request by any person holding a validly issued building or moving permit issued by the city shall temporarily remove raise or lower its wire to permit the movement of buildings the expense of such removal raising or lowering shall be paid by the person requesting same and the franchisee shall be authorized to require such payment in advance the franchisee shall be given not less than 48 hours oral or written notice to arrange for such temporary wire changes f the franchisee shall consult at all times with the city engineer with respect to the use of public rightsofway location of transmission facilities and shall provide service maps for the franchised territory g prior to all excavations of public property other than excavations necessary to effect emergency repairs the franchisee or its agents shall first obtain the necessary permit from the office of the city clerk pursuant to the city municipal code all excavation work shall be completed in accordance with the citys technical specifications permits for emergency excavations may be obtained upon completion of repairs h the city shall have the right to request installation free of charge upon the poles and within the underground pipes and conduits of the franchisee any wire and fixtures desired by the city to the extent that installation and maintenance does not reasonably interfere with the franchisees operations technical and safety standards a the franchisee shall establish construct install operate and maintain its system in a manner consistent with all state and federal laws fcc technical standards 47 cfr  and amendments thereto local ordinances and construction standards which are all incorporated in this agreement by reference b the franchisee shall establish construct install operate and maintain its system in accordance with the highest standards of the art of cable communications which are technically and financially feasible the franchisee shall maintain its system facility in a manner which will continue to enable it to add new services and associated equipment as they are developed available and proved marketable to subscribers the new services and associated equipment will be added to the system when the franchisee determines in its sole discretion that they are technically reliable and adaptable to the system at a cost to the subscriber that is acceptable in the marketplace c antenna supporting structures shall be designed painted lighted erected and maintained in accordance with all applicable rules and regulations of the federal aviation administration and all other applicable state or local codes and regulations d the system shall be subject to fcc standards concerning rf leakage 47 cfr  et seq e all of the franchisees plant and equipment located within the franchise area shall be installed located erected constructed reconstructed replaced removed repaired maintained and operated in accordance with good engineering practices performed by experienced maintenance and construction personnel so as not to endanger or interfere with public improvements the city may undertake or to unnecessarily hinder or obstruct pedestrian or vehicular traffic on city properties f the franchisee shall at all times employ ordinary care and shall install maintain and use commonly accepted uses and devices for preventing failures and accidents which are likely to cause damage injuries or nuisances to the public all structures lines equipment and connections belonging to the franchisee shall at all times be kept and maintained in a safe suitable condition and in good order and repair transactions affecting ownership or control of the franchisee or its facilities a the franchisee shall not vest in any person or party without the prior written consent of the city which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld no such consent but only written notice shall be necessary i for the of this franchise filing with regulatory agencies the franchisee shall maintain records in a public inspection file as required by fcc regulations 47 cfr  such records shall be available for public inspection and copying as required by said regulations compliance with applicable laws and ordinances a the franchisee shall at all times during the term of this franchise be subject to all lawful provisions contained herein and in existing applicable resolutions such additional regulations as it shall find necessary in the exercise of the police power provided that such regulations shall be reasonable and insofar as the public interest may permit shall not be in conflict with the rights herein granted c the city shall have the right to monitor all construction or installation work performed subject to the provisions of this franchise and make such inspections as it shall find necessary to insure compliance with the terms of this franchise and other pertinent provisions of law the city shall have the right to inspect such maps plans and other materials of the franchisee as reasonably required to determine compliance with this franchise d at the expiration of the term for which this franchise is granted or upon its termination and cancellation as provided for herein the city shall have the right to require the franchisee to remove at franchisees expense all portions of the system from all public ways within the franchise area service policies a the franchisee shall provide cable service to any occupant of a dwelling unit who requests service including all multiple dwelling unit buildings except those dwelling units to which franchisee cannot obtain access provided that such dwelling unit can be served with a standard drop of no more than 150 feet if an occupant of a dwelling unit who requests service cannot be served with a standard drop the franchisee shall extend the cable system as necessary to provide such service the franchisee shall bear all costs of any such extension provided there is a density in the area to be reached by the extension of at least 25 dwelling units per linear mile of cable plant if there is not a density in the area to be reached by the extension of at least 25 dwelling units per mile then franchisee shall only be obligated to extend its cable system if the occupant or occupants requesting service agree to bear a portion of the costs of the extension the cost allocation shall be determined using the following formula c   nm25 c   the proportion of the total extension costs to be borne by the franchisee n   the actual number of dwelling units that can be served by the extension with a standard drop of no more than 150 feet m   the length of the extension expressed in miles for example if the required extension of the cable system is one mile m 10 and the extension will pass within 150 feet of five dwelling units n 5 then the franchisee shall bear onefifth of the costs five divided by 10  25 and those requesting the extension shall bear the remaining costs b in the event continued use of a street or rightofway is denied for any reasonable reason related to public health safety or welfare the franchisee shall make every reasonable effort subject to subsection a above to provide service over alternate routing c the franchisee shall not as to service facilities rules regulations or any other respect take or grant any undue preference or advantage to any person not subject any person to any prejudice or disadvantage and no person firm or corporation in the franchise area shall be arbitrarily refused service this section shall not prohibit special rates for promotional sales commercial rate structures or free connections and service to franchisee employees d whenever in any place within the franchise area all or any part of the electric or other utilities shall be located underground it shall be the obligation of the franchisee to locate or to cause its property to be located underground within such places and to comply with all ordinances of the city relating to underground service unless such requirement is waived by the governing body pursuant to the city municipal boxes and pedestal mounted terminal boxes may be placed above ground if existing technology reasonably requires but shall be of such size and design and shall be so located as not to be unsightly or unsafe where underground construction is required the franchisee shall have the option of sharing or not sharing in utility trenches e the franchisee shall maintain the system in good condition render efficient service make repairs promptly and interrupt service only for good cause during the franchise term such interruptions for repair testing or other valid purposes shall where possible be limited to periods of minimum usage f upon the request of any private parochial or public elementary or secondary school or any college or university located in pleasant hill or upon request by the city for one of its municipal or public facilities franchisee shall furnish a single service drop to such institution or facility free of installation charge and monthly service charge if the distance between the franchisees nearest distribution or feeder cable and the requesting institution or facility exceeds 1000 feet the franchisee may charge the requestor the reasonable differential expense of providing said drop indemnification of city a the franchisee shall at its sole expense fully indemnify defend and hold harmless the city and in their capacity as such the furnish such bond may be waived or reinstated from time to time by the city forfeiture and termination of franchise in addition to all other rights and powers retained by the city under this franchise or otherwise the city council reserves the right to forfeit and terminate the franchise and all rights and privileges of the franchisee under it in the event of a substantial breach of its terms and conditions  provided in all instances any such forfeiture or termination shall be subject to the due process provisions of the cable act or state or federal law a substantial breach by the franchisee shall include but shall not be limited to the following a violation of any material provision of the franchise or any material rule order regulation or determination of the council made pursuant to the franchise  b attempt to evade any material provision of the franchise or practice any fraud or deceit upon subscribers or upon the city government  c failure to restore systemwide service after 72 consecutive hours of interrupted service except when approval of the interruption is obtained from the city council which approval shall not be unreasonable withheld  or d material misrepresentation of fact in the application for or negotiation of the franchise the above shall not constitute a substantial breach if the violation occurs but it is without fault of the franchisee or if it occurs as a result of circumstances beyond its direct control such as war civil disturbance natural catastrophe and other acts of god or failure of timely receipt of licenses or easements from utility companies the franchisee shall not be excused by mere economic hardship nor by misfeasance nor malfeasance of its directors officers or employees the city may make a written demand that the franchisee comply with any provision rule order or determination under or pursuant to this franchise if the violation by the franchisee continues for a period of 60 days following written demand without written evidence that the corrective action has taken or is being actively and expeditiously pursued the city may consider the issue of terminating the franchise provided that the city shall cause to be served upon the franchisee at least 30 days prior to the date the city is to consider the issue of termination a written notice of intent to request termination and the time and place of meeting public notice shall be given of the meeting and the issue which the city is to consider the city council or its duly designated representative shall hear and consider the issue and shall hear any person interested in it and the city council shall determine in its reasonably exercised discretion whether or not any violation by the franchisee has occurred if the city council shall determine the violation by the franchisee was the fault of the franchisee and within its control the council may by resolution declare that the franchise of the franchisee shall be forfeited and terminated unless there is compliance within such period as the council may fix but not be less than ten days provided that no opportunity for compliance need to be granted for fraud or misrepresentation the issue of forfeiture and termination shall automatically be placed upon the council agenda the expiration of the time set for it for compliance the council then may terminate the franchise forthwith upon finding that the franchisee has failed to achieve compliance or may further extend the period at its discretion procedure upon termination upon expiration of the franchise if the franchisee shall not have acquired an extension or renewal thereof and accepted the same the franchisee may enter upon the streets and public ways of the city for the purpose of removing therefrom any or all of its property and otherwise and in so removing said property the franchisee shall refill at its own expense any excavation that shall be made by it and shall leave such streets and public ways and places in as good condition as that prevailing prior to the franchisees removal of its property new developments performance evaluation and disputes a the field of cable communications is a relatively new and rapidly changing field which may see many regulatory technical financial marketing and legal changes during the term of this franchise therefore in order to provide for a maximum degree of flexibility in the franchise and to help achieve a continued advanced and modern system the city and the franchisee shall hold a scheduled performance evaluation session within 30 days of the third anniversary date of this ordinance and every three years thereafter or as may be required by federal or state law all evaluation meetings shall be open to the public either party may notify the other in writing at least 60 days in advance of each of the specified performance evaluation meetings b special evaluation sessions may be held at any time during the term of the franchise at the request of the city or the franchisee c all evaluation sessions shall be open to the public and announced in a newspaper of general circulation in accordance with the notice requirements of section 16 above no newspaper notice shall be required as to any adjourned sessions the franchisee shall notify subscribers of all scheduled evaluation sessions in writing at its option the franchisee may give such notice by announcement on its system d topics which may be discussed at any scheduled or special evaluation sessions may include but are not limited to service rate structures access channel administration institutional use penalties free or discounted service stateoftheart and applications of new technologies system performance services provided programming offered customer complaints privacy amendments to this ordinance modifications to the franchise judicial and fcc rulings and franchisee or city rules e during a review and evaluation by the city the franchisee shall fully cooperate with the city and shall provide information and documents as the city may need to reasonably perform its review f if at any time during its review the city determines that reasonable evidence exists of inadequate system performance it may require the franchisee to perform mutually agreeable tests and analysis directed toward the suspected inadequacies the franchisee shall fully cooperate with the city in performing the testing and shall prepare results and a report if requested within 30 days after notice g the governing body of the city may if it deems it advisable amend this ordinance so as to enable the franchisee or the governing body franchisee to take advantage of any developments which will afford the franchisee andor the governing body an opportunity to move efficiently comprehensively or economically serve the subscribers this section shall not be construed so as to require the governing body to amend any provision of this ordinance or to require the franchisee to implement services or standards it reasonably deems unmarketable or not economical at the time h should any disputes arise between the franchisee and the city over any of the terms contained in this ordinance or the performance of their respective obligations including proceedings under sections 16 and 17 both parties agree to use their respective best efforts to resolve such dispute faith discussion subscriber complaints a the franchisee shall have a listed tollfree telephone number for service calls and emergency service shall be available 24 hours a day seven days a week the number shall be made available to subscribers and the general public normal service calls shall be handled during regular business hours the franchisee also shall provide an unlisted telephone number to the city and utility companies to enable the city or utility companies to reach the franchisee in case of emergency on a 24hour seven day a week basis b the franchisee shall respond to and resolve subscribers complaints or requests for service in connection with repairs and maintenance and malfunctions of system facilities the franchisee shall respond as quickly as possible to complaints and requests but shall in any case respond within 24 hours all complaints concerning repairs and maintenance shall be resolved within seven business days to the extent reasonable complaints or requests which may pose a potential health and safety hazard will be responded to immediately in connection with billing complaints the franchisee shall respond within seven business days c reserved d all subscribers and members of the general public may direct complaints regarding franchisees service or performance to the city the city shall ensure that all subscribers and members of the general public have access to public hearings scheduled in conjunction with regular or special evaluation sessions described in section 18 e the franchisee shall prepare and file with the city copies of all of its rules and regulations in connection with the handling of subscriber inquiries requests and complaints as subscribers are connected or reconnected to the system the franchisee shall by appropriate means such as a card or brochure furnish information concerning the procedures for making inquiries or complaints including the name address and local telephone number of the employee or employees or agent to whom inquiries or complaints are to be addressed franchise fee the franchisee in consideration of the privilege granted under this franchise for the operation of a cable communications system the use of public rightsofway and the expense of regulation pursuant to the franchise incurred by the city shall pay quarterly to the city a franchise fee in an amount equal to three percent of the gross revenues payment shall be made within 60 days following the end of the quarterly period to which said payment should apply each payment shall be accompanied by a statement clearly showing the basis for its computation any payment which remains unpaid on its due date shall be delinquent and shall thereafter accrue interest at the maximum legal rate until paid upon reasonable notice the city or its authorized representatives at its expense shall have the right to review the pertinent books and records of the franchisee to verify that the franchise fee has been correctly computed and paid to the extent allowed by law the city and its representative shall keep all such information confidential subscriber rates monthly rates for subscriber service shall be determined by franchisee and shall be uniform throughout the franchise area for each type of service subscriber rates for installation shall be determined by franchisee and shall be uniform except where extraordinary installation procedures are required in order to establish service in which case franchisee may charge the subscriber the actual cost of materials and labor plus ten percent where a subscribers service is disconnected for nonpayment of monies due franchisee is authorized to collect a reconnection fee the franchisee shall not discriminate in the assessment levy charge imposition or collection of rates on the basis of age race creed color religion national origin sex or marital status nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit the reduction or waiving of charges in conjunction with promotional campaigns for the purpose of attracting subscribers or users the city expressly reserves the right to approve the rates which the franchisee charges its subscribers for basic service and other services if the governing body is permitted to regulate said rates or other services by law after adoption of this ordinance said approval and regulation shall only be applied prospectively miscellaneous provisions a from and after the effective date of this ordinance it shall be unlawful for any person to construct install or maintain within any public street within the franchise area or within or upon any other public property within the franchise area or within or upon any privately owned area within the franchise area which has not yet become a public street but is designated or delineated as a proposed public street of any tentative subdivision of the franchise area any equipment or facilities for distributing any television or radio signals cable communication system unless a franchise authorizing such use of such street of property or area has first been obtained and unless a franchise is in full force and effect b it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation to make any unauthorized connections whether physically electrically acoustically inductibly or otherwise in any part of a franchised cable communication system within programs or sound penalties any person violating or failing to comply with any of the provisions of section 22 of this ordinance shall be guilty of theft of service and is subject to prosecution as requirement of the franchise granted hereunder and shall in no event be considered in the calculation of franchise fees pursuant to this ordinance the franchisee shall incorporate into its system the capability which will permit the city in times of emergency to override the audio portion of all channels simultaneously the franchisee shall designate a channel which will be used for emergency cablecast of both audio and video the franchisee shall cooperate with the city in the use and operation of the emergency alert override system severability if any section subsection sentence clause or successors and assigns the franchise granted and described herein shall be in force for a period of 20 years from the effective date hereof the grantee is hereby granted the right permission and authority to construct operate and maintain all facilities necessary for the production transmission and distribution of electrical power and energy for the purpose of carrying on a general power and light business and other operations connected therewith or incident thereto within the corporate limits of said grantor as the same now exist or may hereafter be extended including but not limited to the construction operation and maintenance of electrical facilities in along over across and under all streets alleys avenues lanes or other public places or thoroughfares and to trim and remove trees upon and overhanging such places within such limits of the grantor such facilities shall include poles transmission lines distribution lines anchors guy wires cables conduits street lighting poles transformers and all other apparatus and appliances incident thereto any pavements sidewalks or curbing taken up and any and all excavations made shall be done in such a manner as to cause the least reasonable inconvenience to the inhabitants of the grantor and to the general public  and repairs and replacements shall be made by and at the expense of the grantee with all reasonable speed leaving such properties in as good condition as before rules and regulations the grantee shall supply electrical service within the present or future corporate limits of the grantor under terms of the grantees rules and regulations and rate schedules as now or hereafter filed with and approved by the public service commission of the state of missouri hold harmless in constructing operating and maintaining such production transmission and distribution facilities and related apparatus the grantee shall hold save and keep harmless the grantor from any loss injury or damage to life or property occasioned by reason of the negligence of the grantee or any of its employees if an event occurs for which grantor claims indemnity from grantee grantor shall immediately notify grantee of said event no exclusive franchise franchise rights and privileges granted by this ordinance shall not be construed or interpreted to be exclusive to the grantee transfer of rights and obligations all rights privileges and authority hereby granted to the grantee shall inure to the benefit of its successors and assigns subject to all the terms provisions and conditions herein contained and all obligations hereby imposed upon the grantee shall be binding upon its successors and assigns in the same manner acceptance no right privilege or authority given or granted by this ordinance shall become effective until accepted by the grantee by written instrument executed and acknowledged by it as a deed is required to be within 30 days of passage by the governing body two copies of the acceptance shall be marked so as to indicate the receipt of such acceptance and shall be returned to the grantee by the clerk conflicting ordinances all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed effective date this ordinance shall be effective immediately after its final passage and approval by the city council read three times and passed by the city council of the city of pleasant hill missouri the 14th day of october 1991 approved this 14th day of october 199 and effective the 18th day of october 1991 article iii  gas ordinance no1648 an ordinance granting to missouri gas energy a division of southern union company a delaware corporation operating a gas distribution system in the city of pleasant hill missouri its successors or assigns a franchise to operate a natural gas distribution plant and system in said city and relating thereto be it ordained by the council of the city of pleasant hill missouri footnotes  4  editors note printed herein is granting a gas distribution system franchise to missouri gas energy company as adopted by the city council on  amendments to the ordinance are indicated by parenthetical history notes following amended provisions the absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original ordinance obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation for stylistic purposes a uniform system of headings catchlines capitalization citation to state statutes and expression of numbers in text has been used to conform to the ordinances additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets grant of authority that there is hereby granted to missouri gas energy a division of southern union company a delaware corporation operating a gas distribution system herein called the company its successors and assigns the rights privileges and franchise for a period of 20 years from  to construct maintain and operate in the present and future streets alleys bridges and public places in the city of pleasant hill missouri herein called city its gas distribution system as now located together with the right privilege and franchise to acquire construct maintain and operate therein and thereon such additions and extensions thereto as may be necessary or desirable all for the purpose of supplying natural gas for all purposes to the inhabitants of said city and consumers in the vicinity thereof which grant shall be subject to all lawful ordinances of the city of pleasant hill now in existence of hereafter enacted which are not inconsistent herewith provided further that the company shall upon acceptance of this franchise be obligated to remove relocate or adjust as promptly as is practical any of its gas distribution facilities located in or upon the citys streets alleys bridges or other public places at no expense to the city when reasonably requested to do so by the city such requests made by the city shall be deemed reasonable unless shown to be otherwise by the company rates and charges  operating rules all rates established and charges made by company for gas transported distributed and sold hereunder shall be subject to valid and lawful orders of the public service commission of the state of missouri and other competent authority having jurisdiction in the premises and the transportation distribution and sale of gas to consumers shall be governed by the present operating rules regulations and customs of company and such rules and regulations as may hereafter be prescribed or approved companys duties re service generally that in consideration of and as compensation for the right privilege and franchise hereby granted the company its successors and assigns shall furnish gas at such pressure and of such quality as shall be designated by lawful orders of the public service commission of said state if such gas is reasonably procurable  shall furnish to each consumer a recognized standard meter or other instrument for measurement of gas sold or computation of consumers bills and keep same in repair at its cost which meter shall at all times be subject to inspection by said city  shall at all times save the city harmless from any and all damages which said city may be liable to pay that may arise from the construction maintenance and operation by the company of its plant system or any part thereof  shall limit all excavations of streets alleys or public places to the necessity of efficient operation and shall not at any one time open or encumber more of any highway or public place than shall be reasonably necessary to enable company to proceed with advantage in laying or repairing mains or pipes and shall not permit such highway or public place to remain open longer than necessary for the purpose for which it was opened  shall refill all excavations and replace all pavements with like material and leave same in as good condition as when altered or removed  shall perform all work on streets alleys and public places under supervision of a representative of said city if so desired  and shall repay said city all expense to which it has been put in the repair or replacement of streets highways or pavements in the event such work is done by said city after the neglect or refusal of company to perform same in a reasonable time company to make monthly report to city company shall not later than the first day of each calendar month in each year make a report to the governing board of the city of its gross receipts from the sale of natural gas for domestic and commercial purposes within the corporate limits of said city for the onemonth period ending on the first day of the month next preceding that on which the report is due  and at the time of making such reports pay into the city treasury a sum equal to five percent of said gross receipts subsequent to the effective date of this franchise so long as company shall be required by any regulatory authority having jurisdiction to separately state the franchise tax increment of its charges for natural gas service rendered under the franchise hereby granted the term gross receipts as used herein shall not include the separately stated tax increment said percentage of companys gross receipts is hereby levied and assessed as an occupation and license tax in lieu of all other occupation license or other revenue taxes or feesfor the privilege of engaging in the business herein recited during the term hereof  and as a further consideration for this franchise company agrees to recognize the same as a valid tax and make said payments during such periods effective date if a majority of the council express their assent to the granting of said franchise said franchise shall become effective immediately provided that the company shall file its written acceptance of said franchise within 30 days from the date said governing body shall have declared the results of said vote passed this 28th day of january  2008 alleys and other public places in the city of pleasant hill county of cass state of missouri to conduct the business of installing maintaining managing and operating a telephone system with all necessary poles wires cables fixtures and apparatus be it ordained by the council of the city of pleasant hill cass county missouri as follows footnotes  5  editors note printed herein is granting a telephone system franchise to united telephone company of missouri as adopted by the city council on  amendments to the ordinance are indicated by parenthetical history notes following amended provisions the absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original ordinance obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation for stylistic purposes a uniform system of headings catchlines capitalization citation to state statutes and expression of numbers in text has been used to conform to the ordinances additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets grant of authority  terms and restrictions that the united telephone company of missouri a corporation organized under the laws of the state of missouri with a license to do business in the state of missouri its successors and assigns be and they are hereby granted the right in the city of pleasant hill to conduct the business of installing maintaining managing and operating a telephone system to construct and maintain all the necessary poles wires cables poles and wire fixtures telephone plant and telephone apparatus of whatsoever nature for the purpose of conducting such business to erect and maintain such telephone poles with the usual fixtures and string the same with wire and cable along the streets avenues boulevards alleys and other public places of said city of pleasant hill and to construct or lay and maintain such conduits as grantee its successors and assigns may require under the streets avenues boulevards alleys and other public places aforesaid for the purpose of such business under the following terms and restrictions towit 1 term the term of this grant shall be for 20 years from this date subject to all ordinances regulating taxing and controlling telephone lines of systems in the city of pleasant hill missouri 2 duty to provide service generally the grantee its successors and assigns shall conduct such telephone business in such a manner as shall be to the benefit of the city of pleasant hill and its inhabitants rendering good telephone service at reasonable rates as authorized by the missouri public service commission or any other state or local government agency charged by law with the power to regulate public utilities 3 location of poles wires and cables all poles and overhead wires or cables erected under this ordinance shall be placed whether on streets avenues boulevards alleys or other public places as not to interfere unnecessarily with the ordinary travel on such streets avenues boulevards alleys or other public places all poles erected under this ordinance shall be located as not to injure unnecessarily any drains sewers catchbasins or other like public improvements and said grantee shall forthwith repair any damages so caused to the satisfaction of the government of said city and in default thereof said city may repair such damage and charge the cost thereof to and collect same from said grantee 4 poles not to interfere with other public service companies the poles of the grantee its successors and assigns shall be placed and erected in such a manner as not unreasonable unreasonably to interfere with the orderly conduct of the business and the rights of any other public service corporation having a right or franchise to operate its business in said city 5 placement of poles and conduit subject to supervision of city all work of locating and erecting poles or placing underground conduit under and by virtue of this ordinance shall be done under the supervision of the mayor or his authorized representative 6 grantee to hold city harmless the grantee shall hold the city of pleasant hill free and harmless from all damages arising by reason of any abuse or negligence in said occupancy for the payment of which said city may have become liable to any person persons or corporations by reason of the granting of this ordinance or by reason of the construction of operation of said telephone system or by reason of said telephone company failing to conform or comply with any of the provisions or requirements of this ordinance 7 grantee to move poles wires etc upon notice the said telephone company shall remove raise or adjust its aerial plant after 48 hours notice by the mayor or another properly authorized city official for the purpose of permitting the moving of houses or other structures along the streets of said city  however the person or persons for whose benefit such telephone plant is removed raised or adjusted shall first secure proper permission from said city for the moving and agree to pay said telephone company for its related costs and damages if desired an advance deposit by the mover may be required by the telephone company 8 authority to trim trees permission is hereby granted to the telephone company to trim trees upon and overhanging streets alleys sidewalks and public places of said city so as to prevent the branches of such trees from coming in contact with the wires and cables of the telephone company all the said trimming to be done with the approval of any city official to whom said duties have been or may be delegated 9 grantee to enter into agreements for joint usage of poles the telephone company shall whenever feasible enter into agreements with other public utilities operating within said city for the joint usage of poles 10 annual audit grantee hereby agrees to furnish to the city of pleasant hill missouri a certified audit of its business accounts on an annual basis 11 citys right to renegotiate terms of grant the city of pleasant hill shall have the option to renegotiate the terms of this grant at any time during the term of this grant by giving written notice of such intention to grantee however the terms contained herein shall continue to be in full force and effect throughout the term of this grant unless this ordinance be amended or repealed 12 license tax in consideration for rights and privileges herein granted to said telephone company there is hereby levied on all telephone companies operating or doing business in the city of pleasant hill a license tax in a sum equal to five percent of the gross receipts from such business on and after  and such payments shall be made twice a year the 15th day of january and july of each year for the period covered during the term of this ordinance same shall be in lieu of any general or special license tax occupation tax or any other such tax for the period covered during the terms of this ordinance but shall not exempt telephone companies from the payment of levies on real or personal or any other taxes 13 grantee to file acceptance said telephone company shall file its acceptance of this ordinance with the clerk of said city within 30 days after its passage and approval 14 penalties any telephone company violating this ordinance shall on conviction be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and punished by a fine not exceeding $10000 and each days violation of this ordinance shall constitute a separate offense 15 repealed is hereby repealed 16 assignment permitted this franchise as well as the rights hereunder may be assigned by the grantee as well as all succeeding grantees at their option and the assigns shall succeed to all the rights duties and liabilities of the grantee hereunder 17 effective date this ordinance shall be in full force and effective from and after its passage by the city council and approval by the mayor and its acceptance by said telephone company passed and adopted by
